result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Cortez Coleman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court.  Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court for David Cortez Coleman.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. Defense filed Motion to Suppress Evidence and requested motion hearing date. Jury Trial remains calendared for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 36. State to file motion response by November 07, 2022. Motion hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence: On-Scene Statements.  Received and Filed.  nk
Pretrial Services 10-24-2022 Supervision Report
Signed and filed: Order regarding substitution of counsel

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court.  Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court for David Cortez Coleman.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury status hearing. Court is in receipt of a stipulation allowing for defense counsel Jane Christopherson to be retained as defense counsel. Court GRANTS the substitution of defense counsel. Defense requests an adjournment on the jury trial date. Court orders the jury trial date VACATED.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Proposed Order regarding substitution of counsel
Received and Filed. Stipulation for Substitution of Counsel with cover letter
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-26-2022
Received and Filed.

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court, by zoom, with attorney Fred Richardson.  Patrick J Anderson for Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Cortez Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defendant appeared in person and became ill; defendant appeared by zoom.  State made offer.  Defense requested adjournment due to needing more time to communicate with defendant.  State to leave offer open until jury status hearing.  Jury status hearing remains calendared for August 26, 2022 at 1:30 pm and jury trial August 29, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn.  Received and Filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Defense informs the court of a possible resolution.  Defense further informs that defendant plans to hire private counsel.  Attorney Richardson will remain on the case.  Court advised the defendant that new counsel must appear at the next court date.  Court scheduled another final pre-trial and a jury status hearing date.  Jury Trial remains calendared on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Motions to be filed prior to final pretrial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson. Jessica Bellows on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer J. Gibbs.   Court took judicial notice of 07CF2543. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court reminded the defendant to continue working with Justice Point.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated April 29, 2022 - received

22RM021182  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/23/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David Cortez Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant David Cortez Coleman in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
